thread.section_title: Eastern Iowa Sports News and Information from Gazette Online
thread.title: Kennedy, Washington climb to 3, 4

title: Kennedy, Washington climb to 3, 4
text:
Kennedy, Washington climb to 3, 4 Kennedy, Washington climb to 3, 4 Football: Cougars, Warriors have secured 4A district titles Gazette , Iowa Prep Sports , Prep Football , Prep Sports , Preps Etc. By Jeff Linder , Sports , Sports Rotator , Photos Cedar Rapids Washington’s Isaiah Nimmers (2) reaches out to stiff-arm defenders during the Warriors’ 39-20 win over Iowa City High on Friday. The Warriors climb to No. 4 in the Class 4A rankings in this week’s Gazette/KCRG/KGYM football poll. (Andy Abeyta/The Gazette) Iowa Football Data Center 
I've covered Iowa football at The Gazette since 1999 Monday October 19, 2015 
Columnist giving commentary and information about sports in Iowa. Tuesday October 20, 2015

Sharing community and high school contributed stories Friday October 16, 2015 Jeff Linder , The Gazette October 19, 2015 | 2:26 pm 
From three wins to No. 3 in the state. That’s the one-year upward trek that Cedar Rapids Kennedy has taken. 
Kennedy and Cedar Rapids Washington each climbed a notch in this week’s Class 4A rankings in the Gazette/KCRG/KGYM football poll, released Monday afternoon. 
West Des Moines Dowling remains the top team, while Bettendorf is No. 2. Then it’s the Metro duo, both of which have clinched district championships, at 3 and 4. 
Kennedy (8-0) wrapped up the District 5 title with a 21-7 win over Cedar Falls. The Cougars play at Waterloo West on Friday, and can put a bow on their first perfect regular season in school history. They were 3-7 last season. 
Washington (7-1) has won six straight games since a 28-24 loss to Kennedy in Week 2. The Warriors clinched the District 6 crown with a 39-20 win at Iowa City High last week, and are heavily favored to beat Burlington on Friday. 
The Cougars and the Warriors moved up after West Des Moines Valley was upset by Ankeny Centennial, 16-14. Valley fell from third to seventh. 
Pella remains a unanimous No. 1 in Class 3A. The Dutch are followed by West Delaware (a 13-9 victor over Independence) and Cedar Rapids Xavier (which rallied from a 28-point halftime deficit to beat Iowa City Regina, 38-35). 
Despite its loss, Regina stayed No. 1 in Class 1A. The Regals maintained seven of eight first-place votes; No. 2 Dike-New Hartford received the other. 
For the third straight week, Albia and Spirit Lake share the No. 1 spot in Class 2A. Albia nabbed four first-place votes, Spirit Lake three. South Tama is No. 3 this week and plays at No. 5 Aplington-Parkersburg on Friday for the district crown. 
BGM and Newell-Fonda stay on top in Class A and 8-Player, respectively. 
The final poll of the season will be released next Monday.
